questions.question: What is a good way to prepare before an academic lecture?
answers: Use a phone during the lecture.

questions.question: Why is note-taking important during lectures?
What should you do if you don’t understand a point?
answers: Write it down and ask later.
questions.correct: Write it down and ask later.

questions.question: How can you identify main ideas in a lecture?
Why is it useful to understand lecture structure?
answers: It helps predict and organize information.
questions.correct: It helps predict and organize information.

questions.question: How should you handle unfamiliar vocabulary?
answers: Note it and look up later.
questions.correct: Note it and look up later.

questions.question: What is the benefit of summarizing after a lecture?
How can active listening improve comprehension?
answers: By focusing fully on the speaker.
By ignoring parts of the lecture.
By preparing questions in advance only.
questions.correct: By focusing fully on the speaker.

questions.question: Why is asking questions during or after a lecture helpful?
What is the role of examples in academic lectures?
Why should you review your notes soon after a lecture?
answers: To reinforce memory and fill gaps.
questions.correct: To reinforce memory and fill gaps.

questions.question: What is a useful strategy when the lecture is fast-paced?
answers: Focus on keywords and main ideas.
questions.correct: Focus on keywords and main ideas.

questions.question: How can discussing lecture topics with peers help?
answers: It deepens understanding through different views.
questions.correct: It deepens understanding through different views.

questions.question: Why is it helpful to record lectures (with permission)?
answers: To review and catch missed information.
questions.correct: To review and catch missed information.

questions.question: How can you stay focused during long lectures?
answers: Take short breaks and stay hydrated.
questions.correct: Take short breaks and stay hydrated.
